column1: Text
Bergamot is reminiscent of orange or lemon extract, but with it's own particular personality.  It is a delicious substitute for lemon flavoring in teas and cookies. It makes a nice cologne, too.
These are the best chocolate covered coffee beans that I have ever had.  They are very fresh and very tasty.  I ordered a pound for my mother in law.

I love these cinnamon candies.  They are not the same as the cinnamon disks or imperials.  Much better!  I am having trouble finding them.  Was able to get the 2# bag at Wal-Mart but the last two times I have been there, they have not had any.
Seems Brach's is doing away with this mint which is a shame.  By far the best Cinnamon mint on the market.

I love the Brach's Star Brites Cinnamon Mints.  However, I always bought them at WalMart for approximately $2.99 per bag.  I can't buy them again at the price I paid.  Why were they at least $15.00 more per bag.  I find that unconsionable.  You asked me for my opiniion now I would like your answer to my opinion.  Thank you.
Have always kept these available at work, a lot of disappointed people there now. The very best cinnamon candy on the market, well it use to be. Hope Brach's will bring them back!

I quit smoking 6 1/2 years ago and these Brach's cinnamon disks have been a staple in my house. I, too, was buying the 2# bags at Walmart, who has stopped carrying them at all.  One local grocery store has the smaller bags, one.  And if they sell out, I am left scrounging for knockoffs which are nothing like the Brach's brand.Please, Brach's, do not discontinue.

These are wonderful "desk" candies...everyone who stops by takes at least one. Spicy but not too hot. The problem is finding them. As another reviewer stated, I used to find them at Wal Mart but haven't in a while. I just WILL NOT pay $16.50 plus shipping for 2# of candy as listed by one seller here on Amazon. Yes, they are good, but whoa...I MIGHT pay $8/pound for some good fudge or really fine chocolates, but not for a plain hard candy like this.

We had been looking for a long time for a decent decaf black tea to have in the afternoon and evenings. Tried this Typhoo on a whim. After a long search of tasting no flavour decafs, we were elated to find this robust and lovely. We are very pleased that the search is over!

This is so flavorful and decaf! This is the best decaf on the market. I would usually use 2 decaf bags just to have color in my tea.  Typhoo just one round bag does the trick.  You will not be disappointed.

I buy this in the UK but it is wonderful to know I can get it here if supplies run low between trips! I recommend steeping the bag for several minutes, then adding milk and sugar to taste. It has been a lifesaver during cold and flu season. I prefer it to PG Tips, which I find to be quite bitter. Typhoo has a much smoother taste.

I love this tea...in fact it is the only hot drink I drink and I have ordered it several times but I won't again!Several of the bags are torn...when you open the silver foil pack...always very careful when I do...you can see small tears in many of the bags and of course the tea is leaking out.I have never had this happen before...and I always buy this brand.  So either this was a bad "batch" or the quality control is slipping.Buyer beware!!!!!!!!!!!

I gave up caffeine ten years ago. I spent months and months trying to find a decaf black tea that actually had flavor or didn't taste like seaweed. (Seriously. Lipton decaf tastes fishy.) I finally found a few brands that were fantastic. Decaf PG Tips is solid. But decaf Typhoo is, by far, the best decaf tea I'ver ever tasted. In fact, it's the only decaf brand I will purchase.If you've been disappointed with decaf teas, give Typhoo a try. You'll be shocked at its strong, full-bodied flavor.Having said that, these days, to save cash, I usually make my own decaf tea. Turns out something like 90% of the caffeine in a regular tea bag is released in the first 30 seconds of brewing time. So, if I want a cup of tea late at night I heat enough water for two cups, brew the bag for 30 seconds in the first cup then toss that stuff and drop the now-decaffeinated bag in the fresh hot water.But I always keep some decaf Typhoo on hand when I don't have the patience to make my own decaf tea.
This tea is difficult to find and is fantastic.  Highly recommend it.  Good service from the vendor.
In England babies have this mixed with their milk formula and then in the younger years its customary to drink cups of this nectar. YAHOO TYPHOO!
I live in Japan and it is little difficult for me to getdecaffeinated tea bag here.I sent it to my brother's address.It is really helpful to find this kind of stuff on the amazon.com!

I have to drink decaf tea in the evenings and before I found this Typhoo I always had to trade off decent tasting tea for being able to sleep at night. But Typhoo decaf makes a very robust and flavorful pot of tea. On more than one occasion, somebody in the family has grabbed this decaf by mistake and nobody even realized it was decaf until we noticed the distinctive round bag in the bottom of the pot. This tea is best brewed by the pot using fully boiling water. If you try to make it by the individual cup using 190 degree water or water heated in a microwave, you'll probably be disappointed. Besides compromising the flavor, brewing by the cup would be wasteful since a single bag makes a good three cups of tea. The only compromise needed when brewing this decaf over regular black tea is the decaf needs to steep a bit longer (I'd say ten minutes) for maximum flavor. Alternatively, you can limit the water to two cups and then it's ready in about six minutes. Typhoo also makes regular caffeinated black tea which I consider to be just average.
Hard to find a decaf tea with such great flavor and strength.Typhoo is terrific.I've tried a number of different decaf teas and this is undoubtedly one of the best.
I really liked this tea an have no complaint about it... like the extra leaf taste in it kinda makes it a little stronger tasting tea an not water tating

In my hunt for good strong decaf, I've tried many. This is the best, alongside Tetley. I actually drink a 14 ounce cup in the morning using one bag of Tetley decaf and one bag of Ty-phoo. One would be hard pressed to guess it was full decaf. I'm throwing out my PG Tips. After forty-or-so cups, I've given it a good trial, but it's just too "green" for me. Sticking with this one...just placed another order. Ty-phoo is strong, with no weird designer tea flavors added, and no off-tastes. As close to the caffeinated tea you really want to drink as you will get.

This is a great tea on the strong side which is just the way I like it.  I will drink this cold or hot and love the tase.  I sometimes combine it with green tea to get the benefits of the black and green teas together!  A true English tasting tea.  If you enjoy strong, full-bodied, teas you will love Ty-phoo!  The decaf does not take away from the flavor.  You will not be disappointed!  One bag will brew 2 cups of tea easily!
Very nice company to work with. My first shipment was damaged and they immediately overnighted me a new order.PG Tips 80 Tea Bags

(I'm in Arkansas, not Argentina)Typhoo tea is a traditionally British blend and the Decaf version won't dissapoint you. Assam tea is a large part of the blend which adds the "maltiness" and mouth feel that drinkers of Irish and Scottish Breakfast teas enjoy. I never drink this type of tea without milk and it was blended to be enjoyed that way. These are larger teabags than you'll find with Twinings or Bigalow brands of "breakfast" tea. I've been a tea lover for 35 years and spent many years in the UK drinking all kinds of teas, my daily black tea is Typhoo Decaf because :- a water based meathod decaffeinates the tea, no chemicals are ever used- Typhoo has a full flavor of malty Assam lightened with Ceylon (compared to PG Tips which is lighter on Assam, less malty)- the round teabags are designed to filter the maximume flavor from the tea- 1 teabag makes a heafty 12oz mug or slightly lighter 14oz pot of tea- it's a great cuppa any time of day because there's minimal caffeine (average caffeine in Decaf teas is barely 5mg)- if I over-steep this tea it doesn't get bitterCheck prices around the web and you'll find that Amazon offers the best deal, especially when there's Free Shipping !Typhoo Decaf gets you through the day and makes a relaxing cup before bed. It's the kind of tea you'd be served with rich biscuits and teacakes throughout the UK. if you like a heafty cup of tea with milk this Decaf will take care of you.NOTE : I always check the expiration dates on the boxes when they arrive to be sure a seller hasn't sold me outdated tea. This has only happened once and the seller is no longer on Amazon.
As a Soldier we work crazy hours, this product keeps you hydrated and energized ready to accomplish any mission.  Thank you MIO!

So, basically my morning routine is, wake up, go to work, buy an orange flavor Rockstar, and work; 5 times per week.I spend exactly 2.50 per can of Rockstar. The caffeine i get from it is mentally required for me, i can't function as well without having one.I saw these bottles at Ralphs for about $3.something. I bought this black cherry flavor, which packs 60mg of caffeine per 1/2 tbsp. Yikes! :)So, my routine now is, wake up, go to work, add some flavor to my water, and get to work.Assuming i drink 5 Rockstar's per week: $12.50The MIO black cherry container says it makes 18 8fl oz mixes but it depends on how many squirts you put. The regular water bottles are 16.9 fl oz. I think i can get at least 10 water bottles out of each little MIO.So, (10 approx. bottles * $0.25 approx cost of bottled water) + ($4 MIO) / (5 work days) =  around $6 dollars.If i want to save money, and reduce my overall costs of $13+ per week for energy drinks, I have to count on something with the same amount of kick (caffeine).This stuff has to work for me, and it has, so i recommend it.At least now i will be drinking water + enhancer.
I have a soda machine that is great!  These little bottles hold a lot of flavor that work great with the soda machine and they take up very little room.  Love the Cherry and Orange/Tangerine!

My husband and I recently had sushi at a fantastic restaurant in Annapolis, MD. called Joss. The server suggested that I try this wine with my sushi, so I did. It was so perfect. The wine is light and has a bright clean flavor, kind of cleans your pallette as you eat. I'm no expert, but was really pleasantly surprised. Try it with your sushi, you won't be disappointed.

We usually have to travel to China Town to buy this product and was so happy to have found it on Amazon. It was sent to us quickly and we love this tea which is very good for us. We would order from this company again. Thanks

I had been purchasing loose leaves from another company, but one day when they weren't available, I ordered these bags.  Blech!!  The loose leaves from Immortalitea were such a pleasant tasting product.  These bags are so pungently horrible tasting that one shudders when sipping it.  I can't get past the taste.

If you like bitter, putrid tastes, this may be the tea for you.  The tea tastes so terrible I am sure it will be thrown out.  Gynostemma is supposed to taste good. Something is very wrong with this product.  I drink a lot of herbal teas, so I can usually tolerate new flavor.
I bought jiaogulan from multiple places and this brand doesn't taste right. It tastes bitter with no sweet aftertaste. I would not buy Sheng Tangshen Brand jiaogulan/gynostemma pentaphyllum.
I was not quite sure about the results.  I took only morning and evening.  Result was excellent.  I felt my stomach is smooth.
this tea is for medical use to lower blood pressure. it seems to have diuretic effect

What fun to find candy I loved as a child! Even more wonderful to find these old candies for my kids to enjoy in any season! To be in individual packs to eat in smaller quantities at a time is perfect!
I could not find Nestle Crunch Crisp bars in any store in US.  I was quite happy to find them on Amazon.  The product is superb, delivery was fast and packing perfect.  Thank you!!!

I have been a fan of these since i first saw them - can't have the old time fatty wafer and these are tasty and crisp. I don't mind buying them this way but wish the local store would have continued to order them.
It's hard to find the 20 pack boxes locally.This is convenient and cheaper than thesmall packs. When I can find the big boxes,the price is about the same.
Great product, great taste, but also a great ripoff at $15 when it's available at a local grocery for approx. $3.80 !
This product is great for a quick cup of coffee. If you use a mug I suggest that you use 2 "sticks". It ain't perked but it's close.
I love the flavor. It's my favorite with grape coming in a close second. It's wonderful on a hot day.

Not mutch to say, but my wife and I are both on a diet and we are trying to drink only water.  Water gets very boring after a short time and I love this fruit punch stuff.  We keep a gallon made at all times and its pretty much all we drink.  We get it off amazon for almost half what you pay at giant eagle.  Then we sav any extra 15% for auto reorder.  Can't say enough...

With the summer heat, a cool drink it what hits the spot.  You could drink something like Snapple, but at such a lower cost and just as good (if not better) are these Crystal Light Drink Mixes.  The Fruit Punch is a winner!
Delivery was very fast but the jelly beans were loose in a box and were stale.  I will never buy from this seller again.

One star for never replying to my email in which I included a photograph of a foreign object I found in the first package (looked like a dark brown chunk of foam, along with a hair). I was very much concerned when reading the labels' country of origin that among three, included China (Somehow I doubt that Canada beat out China for pricing = most likely China). Although I'll never know for sure since they never responded to any of my questions/concerns. I wouldn't recommend this product if your concerned about food quality.

If you like me wear and drink black, then this tea is for you. I for the most part keep cautions of fruity teas, I like my tea solid and strong. However this tea had this boldness with a twist of Apricot, which I enjoyed. It is great to break-up a routine of always just black and have some additional flavor to it, and this tea is the one.
This oil is wonderful!  Use it to add kick to pasta or pizza.  Use regular olive oil, fresh garlic, and capers with a four or five drops of this per dish for a wonderful Italian pasta sauce.

If you have yet to try the Zevia line of natural sodas, you're in for a real treat!  Finally, a sugar-free soda that tastes GREAT and isn't loaded with artificial chemicals and flavorings!These drinks are winners for me because they're sweetened with all-natural Stevia, which has zero glycemic affect but all the great taste of sugar... and the flavorings are natural!!  I can drink it all day without going into sugar overload!Thus far I have tried the cola, root beer, orange and the latest, Dr. Zevia... THE BEST!!  Root beer comes in a close second!!  For some reason, I like them better over crushed ice rather than straight out of the can... Seems that these sodas taste even better if they can breathe a bit (or maybe I'm just crazy!).  Either way, TRY ZEVIA, then come back and tell me how right I am!!  LOL!!
I'm so glad to have another caffeinated choice of Zevia than just the cola. This one is obviously modeled after Dr. Pepper... I'd compare it's flavor more to Cherry Dr. Pepper. It's very yummy!

This is not a bad flavor, but it's not a good substitute for Dr Pepper like Veggie burgers are a not a good substitute for Hamburgers.This soda has more of a cherry overtone, but very little bite and is much sweeter than diet Dr Pepper. However, by itself as a new flavor, it's really good and I still would recommend it to others.

Sprout's was having a sale on Zevia 6 packs (I got them for $4.50 a six pack, but they were usually $5.59), so i bought cola, rootbeer, orange, twist, Dr. Zevia, and black cherry flavors. I did not buy the ginger ale as i was never really a fan of any ginger ale.As far as Dr. zevia goes, I is by far the most intense flavor, in my opinion. Too strong for me. Very very cherry...it almost tasted like cough syrup without the consistency. I ignored someone's warnings on this flavor, and now i regret wasting 5 bucks on the six pack. Im a really big diet dr. pepper fan, and Dr. zevia just didnt cut it for me. :/As far as the other flavors go:The orange one seemed a little too light in flavor. (I rate it 4/5)Black cherry was perfect for me! (5/5) Nice flavor and carbonation.Cola (5/5) and rootbeer (5/5)were good too. Cola almost tasted like Diet Rite with slightly less carbonation. Rootbeer is hard to compare to anything.The lemon lime twist one was interesting. As a sierra mist gal, i had high hopes. Unfortunately, i would give it a 3/5. It just had a funny taste to it. Hard to compare it to anything really.This is just my two cents on the flavors.I refridgerated them, so i drank them ice cold. I can't comment on the flavors when they are luke-warm.

This soda is fantastic, I was dreaming of the day it would be made. Seriously its great. My kids love it and the best part is that it is all natural! no cancer causing benzoate- I do not feel guilty drinking this soda every now and then!

A long time ago I tried Zevia's Orange soda and was really disappointed.  Eventually I tried the lemon/lime flavor, which I found similarly underwhelming, but the Cola flavor was actually not bad, although not great.  I do actually quite like their Root Beer flavor though, and have been buying it for awhile now.  So just recently I finally decided to give Dr Zevia a try, after seeing it on the shelves and not expecting it to be that good (I think maybe because I associated the red packaging with the color of Jones Soda's diet cherry flavor, which I tried once and did not like at all, and which usually sits nearby at the store).  So anyway, WOW.  Root Beer is now my second favorite Zevia flavor.  When I indulge in regular sugar-sweetened soft drinks, I prefer Root Beer over Dr. Pepper.  But I now feel that Dr. Zevia is their best offering, and tastes more like the real thing and less like a "diet drink" than any of their other sodas.  I've been getting two six packs of their Root Beer at a time, but from now on I think I'll be buying at least one of Dr. Zevia instead.  I'm very impressed with this drink!

Zevia is eventually going to destroy other diet sodas once they are officially labeled as dangerous. Until then, it is a great secret. Dr. Zevia is the crown jewel. It tastes almost sugary with a complex cherry-like flavor. Get some.

After reading all the warnings about artificial sweeteners, I found these sodas from Zevia. Nothing artificial, just with natural sweetness and no calories. We probably would have had the sweetener Stevia years ago if our domestic producers of artificial sweeteners hadn't interfered. It has been used in Japan for over thirty years.

This is a nice, dark tea with a really rich vanilla flavor. It smells amazing. I've had other vanilla teas that smell sort of artificial, like a vanilla scented candle, and don't have a great taste, but this one smells like real vanilla and is delicious. Perfect for tea-time with cookies.

As someone who does not drink caffeine, I am always challenged to find a great hot beverage. I picked up some of this tea on a whim because Amazon was having a special on it.  I love it.The tea is wonderfully spiced with a great aroma that makes you feel warm and cozy on a cold winter's night.  And, since it's decaf, I don't have to work about it keeping me awake.

I love this tea.  It gives me three cups from one bag and it does not give me a horrible caffeine high!  The taste is the best Chai that I have found out of a bag, even better than the caffeinated version.  Try it.
My wife loves this tea and drinks it in the morning as a pick me up and in the evening to help relax after a hard day's work.  Buying in quantity from Amazon helped make the price very attractive.

This is my FAVORITE tea, and the decaf version is difficult to find in stores.  Was thrilled to find it on Amazon and at a price similar to what I paid in stores previously.  The tea is lightly spicy and a bit sweet (no added sweetener needed, like other teas I also enjoy).  I also like that I can get about a cup & a half of tea out of one tea-bag (re-filling my cup after drinking the first half cup).  Tea bags are individually bagged so they are easy to take-along, too.
This tea is great!  I have been drinking it for at least a year now and never tire of it and nothing else seems to compare.  It is great with honey and a splash of milk.

Tazo's Chai is my favorite, and decaf does not disappoint. It makes its best mug around 8 oz, though I still roll with a 12 oz. mug on occasion and though slightly weaker, is still delish - particularly if I go latte with it. Decaf Chai is my version of sleepytime tea :)
This is the most delicious chai tea I've found that can be purchased in a bag. Try it with milk and sugar, it's fantastic.
i loved this tea especially in winter realy its warming the whole body in cold weather

Very good!  I like that it doesn't have any dairy, egg, peanuts, no allergens to speak of which is important to me.  The taste and texture complement any pizza pie, just as it should.  Sometimes pizza sauces containing cheese overtakes the whole pizza.  I was able to buy just 2 cans of this elsewhere to sample it.  Wish I could buy it by the case here.

My husband and I were at Whole Foods and found this sauce and thought we should try it.  When I went to check out, it was not in the system and they just gave it to us.  It was so good, when my husband deployed, he asked me to send him some.  I went back to Whole Foods and could not find it.  I explained to them that it was not even in the system when I got it the first time and they said that it meant that they must have received it by accident then and that it is not a normal product for them to receive.  I started the hunt all over the city of Colorado Springs and it can not be found anywhere.  I was so happy to find it online and stocked up.  I received it in a timely manner and bubble wrapped individually so I was able to move it from one box to another.

We tried this marinade on a whim. We ended up ordering a case - it's that good! We marinated boneless, skinless chicken breasts overnight and pork tenderloin - both were amazing! We gave a bottle as a gift and the people loved it as well. We will be buying more.
This stuff is excellent on pork steaks.  My husband and I (even my kids) love this stuff.  It's got a bit of a zing, but not too much.  Just great flavor.

I tried this and the chicken flavor for the dogs. Both flavors came in nice large sizes (22 oz instead of dinky 10-12 ounces) and the dogs love the taste/smell of it. If they like it, I'm happy too. My only complaint is that the price has roughly doubled from the time of my first order. Other items fluctuate somewhat, but an almost 100% increase makes this stuff no deal anymore. If you can find it elsewhere, or if the price goes back down, jump on it. Your dogs will, too.

Gosh, such a big can of key ingredients that should be healthy for your beloved animal:meat by-products, soy flour, salt, added color, artificial roasted chicken flavor, sodium nitrite and then also the better stuff which you can read for yourself.It's your beloved pet and your money. I'd save both and shop for a better brand without scary ingredients.

If you are expecting the old Fiber One cereal then you are going to be in for a surprise. This cereal tastes like regular honey cluster cereals and not like Fiber One twigs. It is really good. And it will really make you regular with its amount of fiber. Even my kids enjoyed the taste.Highly recommend, try it, you'll like it.

In my first order, instead of sending Fiber One Honey Clusters, I got six boxes of "Basic Four" cereal. When I complained Amazon sent another shipment, but again, it was all Basic Four. I have given up on Amazon getting this order right and have asked for a refund.

I think this is the best tasting cereal in the Fiber One brand. I have been eating this for breakfast for more than 3 years now. My 2-year old niece snacks on it!At 51% of daily fiber, I found this a great way to get fiber in the morning, and it helps me be regular.I does not pack a lot of calories per serving also- I think 160-170 calories per cup. I tried other fiber-rich organic/health store cereals but either they are too sugary, or taste like cardboard.

The best cereal in the market for its fiber content, and it tastes good. I have been using this product for a few years and it has resolved many digestion digestion issues I had. Why take fiber supplement when one can eat fiber in food?

I've eaten regular Fiber One, but this is SO much more versatile!  Not only is it good with milk, but it's great dry as a midnight snack.  I often pour some in a bowl and eat it like chips while watching TV.My 3 year old son even likes this, which is a a HUGE plus!  He eats it with milk for breakfast, and even likes sharing a bowl with me while we watch TV after dinner.My wife is convinced she hates "fiber cereal", she changed her mind after I got her to try this without telling her what it is.  NOW, this is her choice for a quick breakfast.Now that I know the family likes this, I won't hesitate buying it by the case from Amazon rather than paying the higher prices for an individual box at the grocery store.

Love this product, it tastes great and each serving has 51% of your daily needed fiber. I'd rather have a bowl of this in the morning than to use a fiber supplement. My 3 year old loves it also. Tastes great and is not full of sugar ,like many of the kiddie cereals,so I happily let him have this for breakfast. It's also cheaper on Amazon than in the store.

I am very pleased with the order. The only thing I would change is the amount of time your customers can order your products. This product is 3 months or 6 months before ordering again. I think we should be able to order when we need the item. Three months is too soon and six months is way too much time in between. Other than that the flavor and cost is great. Thank you.

I generally like cereal with a little less sugar.  I can add my own sweetener if I want it.  Otherwise, it is a good flake type cereal with a good quantity of fiber.  It is a little low on protein compared to some cereal, but people generally add some protein by using milk.  You can add your choice of fruit (I usually like a combination of sliced banana and strawberries, and sometimes add blueberries).
Yummy and high fiber cereal, we like to eat it out of the box for a snack as well as with milk.
This cereal is absolutely fantastic...best fiber cereal yet that I've found.  It tastes more like I'm eating something just tasty instead of great for me.  Does wonders for the digestive health too.

Fiber One Honey Clusters accomplishes something most other fiber-laden foods don't: It has flavour!I was originally turned on to this cereal by a nutritional website's ranking of top cereals.  Compared to other "ultra-healthy" cereals like the original Fiber One it may not be the healthiest but it's a nice compromise to get a little sweetness out of your "grown-up" food while still providing some very worthwhile health & nutritional benefits.I don't know that any kids are going to be begging their parents for this because it obviously doesn't have all the sweetness of super-sugary cereals, but it also doesn't taste like cardboard and for those of us grown-ups who still have a bit of a sweet tooth, it fills the bill.  (If you want to add a bit of extra flavour, try it with Vanilla Silk soy milk.)Also, if you're the type of person for whom a single bowl of cereal doesn't cut it hunger-wise, this may have you singing a different tune in your morning shower.  Foods high in fiber give you a greater sense of being full so naturally this cereal should be able to keep you satisfied until your next meal.One word of caution though: For those of you who have not consumed high-fiber foods or taken Metamucil as a supplement before, start small and work your way up.  It's not uncommon to experience some uncomfortable digestive consequences if you try to take in too much fiber all at once without giving your body time to adjust.  In the long-term, though, fiber is obvisouly a fantastic way to keep your digestion in tip-top shape.Since Amazon only sells cereal in bulk, I always recommend taste-testing a single box at your local grocery.  But once you know you like it, the Subscribe & Save program may just save you money AND deliver your groceries to your door!
This is the first fiber cereal that actually tastes great. Finally an easy way to get your daily fiber. I would recommend this highly for anyone who is having trouble getting thier daily fiber.

I have been using this for about 8mos and love it. I do have a hard time finding this so I just get it on line and have it shipped. saves me gas and time and it is less then at a store when I do find it.

Can it be?  A cerial that has "fiber" in it's name that I don't have to mix with another cerial just to choke down?  Yes!!  This is it!  Get your fiber in a way that is actually pleasant.  I love the 21st century!

To be fair to those who must have pre-packaged sweetness in their breakfast cereal I've given this three stars. For readers like myself I'd give only one star. Reviewing this cereal on its own merits, it's OK: it tastes good and contains moderate amounts of fiber and sugar.The problem that I have with this particular Fiber One product (and to an even greater degree with the caramel and raisin-cluster versions) is that it scarcely resembles in any way its namesake, original Fiber One. When my local grocery ran out of the original Fiber One, I picked up this Honey Clusters version, thinking that with 51% of one's daily fiber requirement, it would be a decent substitute for the original, which provides 57% of the daily requirement. I should have read the label more closely: the serving size on which the 51% is based is twice that for the 57% provided by the original Fiber One; in other words, one has to consume more than twice as much in volume to get the same amount of fiber. In so doing, one will also consume almost three times as many calories due to the fact that sugar is present in several forms, including honey and high-fructose corn syrup. Original Fiber One uses aspartame rather than sugar. I really don't think that General Mills should squander the good name of Fiber One on this product.It is also most disingenuous to plaster "low fat" across the front of the package. Of course it is low-fat! Why would a product consisting of mostly grain and sugar contain much fat (other than a small amount for leavening and to help it hold together)?!! What General Mills is trying to imply is that this cereal is not fattening, hardly the case since it contains so many calories. The calories come mostly from sugar, and it could have been worse, though; some of the sweetness is from sucralose, which, contrary to the assertion of one reviewer, has not been proved to be "poison" by any reputable scientific study.Amazon considers all Fiber One cereals to be part of a "product set" and does not allow separate reviews; this is particularly unfortunate in that almost the only thing this product has in common with original Fiber One is the name and its ownership by General Mills. So I will elaborate a little on the original product, which is what any health-conscious person should buy instead. The original Fiber One is tasty, low-calorie, and the most pleasant way I know of to get more than half one's daily requirement of fiber. Some people won't like the form and texture of original Fiber One, however; if General Mills made a Fiber One in flake format that had the same taste and nutritional value of original Fiber One, they would have a virtually perfect product.

First time ever buying food on Amazon. My only concern was the expiration date, but regardless, I made the purchase. Anyway, package of six boxes arrived today, and they expire Aug 2012. So no worries there! This is a great deal compared to buying it at the groceries.

This has been my favorite tea for a number of years. I love it hot or cold, but most of the time I drink it cold. When making it by the glass I take a tall iced tea glass, fill it with very cold spring water and add 2 Raspberry Zinger tea bags. In a couple of minutes I have iced raspberry tea! I drink it unsweetened sometimes but other times I add a little bit of liquid stevia (a natural sweetener found in health food stores that does not have any calories & does not affect your blood sugar) and it is delicious. I sometimes add some fresh squeezed lemon or lime juice. Sometimes I add 6-8 tea bags to a gallon of spring water and make the tea in the fridge. I love to bring a gallon of it to the homes of friends and family when we visit. My sister-in-law recently asked me what brand of tea it was because they had made some iced raspberry herbal tea and it did not taste good like the one I make. I told her it was Celestial Seasons Raspberry Zinger. You can make any flavor of their teas iced by just adding the tea bags to cold water. My husband likes it also! I love it hot too. Everyone has their own tastes, but everyone that I give it to iced thinks it tastes really good.I have even used it to dye some doll's clothes for an antiqie doll some years ago. Teas can be used as a natural dye source.

Raspberry Tea is one of my favorites.  I love tea, and I love raspberry.  This tea has a rich, strong raspberry flavor - but not too strong - it is just right.Icy raspberry tea is perfect.  I put the bags in my water bottle with water, put it in the freezer until ice shards start to form.  It is perfect and delightful.

I've liked this tea for a long time and was very pleased to find it in 6 packs on amazon. It has a very nice flavor, unlike many fruit teas that just smell like fruit and don't taste like much of anything. It's a very pleasant sort of sweet and tart taste. I don't put sugar or anything in it. Also, when brewed, it's a deep raspberry pink color and smells wonderful! I would highly recommend this if you enjoy fruit and/or berry herbal teas!
My wife and I toured the Celestial Seasonings factory last month, and we are now HOOKED on the Raspberry Zinger Tea. I prefer mine chilled, while she likes it warm, but either way it is delicious!

I know it is October and summer is officially over but this tea is good year round. Now it is sweetened with stevia but I think it is not quite sweet enough so I add another packet of stevia. The main flavors in this tea are hibiscus and raspberry. I don't taste much of the roasted chicory or orange peel. This also has blackberry leaves and rasberry leaves but you'd never know it. This is caffeine free and considered an herbal tea so you can drink it day or night. All you do is steep two bags and then pour the tea over ice. Add more sweetener if needed.~The Rebecca Review

While some may like the sweet cloying taste of raspberry tea, and I've tried it, what I like most about this version of raspberry tea is that it's tangy and sour. I love black tea both iced or hot so it's nice to have a tasty alternative as I can drink the Raspberry Zinger tea instead.Recommend.

I love many of the Celestial Seasons teas but this is one of my favorites. I combine it one on one with their Raspberry Green Tea and get the antioxidents I desire from the Green Tea while still betting that punch of raspberry flavor that I love.

Raspberry Zinger is fragrant and tasty, nice fruit taste without being overpowering.  I like it even with a half packet of artificial sweetener as I am diabetic.  One reviewer poo-pooed it because it was too strong...well, steep it for less time, then try it again.  Teas are wonderfully adjustable in that way.  Of course, most of us know that already!If you're in the mood for something warming with just a hint of sweetness and lots of flavor, this tea is for you.

This tea is SUPER sour....taste like lemons. It tastes nothing like tea and I don't taste any raspberries. Very disappointed. Raspberry gardens is SO MUCH BETTER.UPDATE: Oh how wrong I was. I decided to try this coffee on a whim after browsing by it on Amazon. I have a Keurig single-cup brewer and have been looking for a less expensive and more environmentally friendly product than the overpriced k-cups....without giving up the flavor and quality that I like about them. The EkoJava packets fit the bill pretty well. I use them in my reusable Solofill k-cup. Each packet is just the right amount for the Solofill. I deducted 1 star because the flavor isn't quite as robust as with the actual k-cups varieties that I like, but I brew these on a smaller setting (less water) which provides more flavor in each cup. Also, it's important that you do not pack the coffee into the reusable cup too tightly or it will not brew the full amount of coffee. The grounds must have room to expand and allow the water to flow through, so you must leave the grounds as loose as possible for best results with this product! Another good thing about these packets is that the plastic pouch can be fully recycled, where as k-cups are extremely wasteful. For that reason alone, this product is worth a try, but hte flavor is great too!

I use these packets to make my own pods for the Bunn Home Cafe. I don't drink the same flavor every day, so it would be a few days before I rotate back to this flavor, and then I'd have to open another package to even out the amount - leaving me with another partial package. Unpractical to say the least. I bought this to save time and flavor (after exposure to air, the flavor becomes less potent.) and I'm not really saving either. I spend more time trying to tap out the proper amount of grinds to fit into the EcoBrew, and then the package is open, so the leftovers aren't as rich as the first brew.  Package review would be 2 stars out of 5 - the functionality of it is there, but the sizing needs a major improvement to be practical for what it's marketed as.In summary: Taste is great, Package size leaves a lot to be desired. 3.5/5 (rounded to 4)

The first few ingredients are (which indicates the most prevalent ingredients) are water sufficient for processing, meat by-products, chicken, turkey, and wheat gluten. At least there is chicken and turkey in it, which is the only reason it got more than 1 star from me. But other than that its all nasty stuff. Wheat Gluten is just gross and by-products aren't even a real meat! By-products are the stuff leftover once all the actual meat is harvested. We're talking beaks, chicken feet, eyeballs, even chicken poop! I would not recommend this product. It is just not a good quality cat food. I think the only reason why it was cat-approved may be because it contains artificial flavors that taste good to cats and because I usually feed them dry food for dental reasons and wet food puts off much more of a scent for them to enjoy. Even though the price is quite inexpensive, your cat will actually eat more than if you paid for a better quality food, because they will never feel full. Cats need to eat real, identifiable, pure meat, and there just isn't enough real meat in this food. When purchasing a cat (or dog) food, the most important thing to consider is the first 3 ingredients; just make sure those first three are decent ingredients that you can identify and would eat yourself. Now that I know what to look for, I usually buy my pets all natural foods such as Natural Balance, Blue Buffalo, Halo, or Wellness. I bought these vanilla beans in 2007 and five years later they still made a delicious vanilla syrup. I've used them in other recipes although I found them difficult to open since they seem to dry out a bit. When I make vanilla syrup all I do is cut the beans into half inch pieces. To make a syrup bring two cups water and two cups granulated sugar to a boil. Add in eight cut up vanilla beans. When boiling lower heat so that the syrup is still rolling but more like a simmer. Simmer for 15 minutes. You want a bit of the water to evaporate. Then turn off the heat and cover the syrup. Leave it overnight so more vanilla is infused into the syrup. Then strain it through cheesecloth and pour it into a prepared bottle. I use an old vanilla syrup bottle. When you make your own syrup you don't have to worry about preservatives and it tastes way better. You can then drizzle your homemade syrup over fresh fruit or put it in your coffee. But here's something I do not get at all! Did that reviewer really just say "It's a lot cheaper to continue using my Solofill cup to scoop some coffee out of the can"?  I don't get it... the logic I mean. I buy a 2 liter bottle of soda when there's a birthday party or office party, picnic, etc. I KNOW that the bottle will be gone and it's cheaper by the ounce. But that doesn't keep me from buying a 12 oz. can of the same brand of soda!!! Ounce for ounce a can of soda costs FIVE times as much as a 2 liter bottle.  But it doesn't take a coffee snob to figure out after a few days that the ground coffee in that can is losing its flavor the same way a bottle of coke loses its fizz after a few days. If you don't want to spend money on Ekojava coffee packets, then at least buy whole bean coffee and grind it as you use it.But then I suppose someone would say "Why not just buy K-cups then?". Good question - easy answer (in my world anyway).These little sticks of coffee that are ground nicely, weighed out perfectly (instead of the freaking mess you make scooping coffee out of a can or bag), and FRESH! So far, sounds like a K-cup. BUT... I use other things to brew coffee other than a Keurig. The packets work in the Melitta I have in my office. I gave a handful of sticks to my neighbor who tried it in his drip coffeemaker. After trying it a few times, he found that one packet in a drip coffeemaker using a paper filter makes 5 cups of awesome drip coffee! Try that with a K-cup! AND JUST out of curiosity, I stopped by a very cool coffee shop in Boise, Idaho (Salt Tears... VERY cool place!) They have a pour over bar and use the Coava Kone filters instead of paper. I asked him if I could use my coffee packet instead of there DOMA coffee (one of a few roasters in Idaho I would recommend). The water was at 206 degrees and he expertly poured about a third of the water in. The coffee began to de-gas (yeah... ain't gonna happen with ground coffee from a can) and then finished off the pour and we waited. We were both pretty blown away. It was awesome.Bottom line? Not sure I'd recommend this to people who are happy with coffee from a can. And I am NOT knocking those who do. My father scooped Folgers from a can when I was a kid and for years I thought that was the epitome of great coffee (but then, I also used to think hamburger was the highest quality beef). But I confess... that sounds a bit condescending and I realize that many people truly enjoy simple store brand ground coffee in their Keurig. My point it, just because you own a Keurig and a Solofill, doesn't qualify you to write a review for something you've never even tried. Dude... At least try something before you review it. C'mon... really? Okay, I sound like a snob. But I guess that's my point. If you are happy with ground coffee from a can, this probably doesn't make sense. If you are more discriminating than that, and you need something to take with you that is a high quality, one cup solution, is fresh, and you want to use it anywhere in almost anything, then heck yeah... this is a great buy!!!

The flavor of these is just amazing. They are really addicting. They are slightly spicy, but they shouldn't be too spicy for anyone's palette. My 6 year old son really enjoys these, too. I was concerned that these might be too hot, 'Habanero', but the heat is perfect as is the flavor... they are bold, if you like stuff plain--these are not for you... but if you like a robust flavor, a definite must! This is the best product Blue Diamond sells, at least in my book. Spicy bbq flavor, like eating chips, but a much healthier alternative. You will not be sorry for buying these. I order these all the time, great deal on 3 pkg of 1 lb bags. YUM  PS:I am on atkins in the maintenance mode and miss chips, this is the replacement I was looking for: Far less carbs.

These are sooo great tasting and the individual  packaging is  great to get them handy around. Perfect buy to stock up as the individual packets are rare to find and there are many favors available however this one is my favorite.
Love these almonds!  Great flavor -- really hits the spot when those mid-afternoon hunger cravings set in! You won't be disappointed with this purchase!

I used to buy the highly spiced and addictive Wasabi peas from an Asian grocery. They went great with beer. But the crunchiness of the dried peas got to me and my husband after a while, so we stopped getting them. When I run across Blue Diamond Bold Wasabi & Soy Sauce Almonds, I was ecstatic. Now I could once again enjoy the taste of Wasabi as well as enjoy the health benefits of almonds at the same time.You can tell that these almonds are flavored as they have a powdery coating. I was a little bit worried as I remembered that some of the wasabi peas were very hot. In case you're not familiar with wasabi, it is the green paste that is typically served with sushi and diluted down with soy sauce. It is also known as Japanese horseradish, and is quite hot. Fortunately, Blue Diamond has tempered the wasabi with  the savory taste of  soy sauce and it's not as hot as it is in Japanese snack food. But make no mistake, it still has a nice kick, but it doesn't have a long lasting effect. The initial punch of heat fades out quickly to make way for the salty, slightly smoky flavor of soy sauce, making it a very enjoyable snack.5 star snack!

The taste is perfect. Smoky with just enough heat to let you know it is there. These don't have 5 alarm heat if that's what you are looking for. These almonds are perfectly seasoned and very addicting. Great if you are on a ketogenic or low carb diet.

Hello everyone, I just had to write a review for these Wasabi and Soy Sauce flavored Blue Diamond Almonds, because I enjoy them sooooooo much! I am a bit of a wasabi junkie as I love sushi with plenty of soy sauce & wasabi, wasabi flavored shrimp chips, and tuna sandwiches made with wasabi mayonnaise, but my new wasabi flavored favorite are these Wasabi and Soy Sauce Almonds from Blue Diamond. The flavor is fantastic, as it is spicy but not so much to bring tears to your eyes. Also, the price of this product is great as well. Sometimes when my money is tight, and sushi is a little too pricey, I like to buy these almonds as an cheaper alternative, to satisfy my wasabi craving. Treat yourself to these awesome almonds today!

The Jalapeno Smokehouse almonds taste great and are a nice healthy option for a snack. The flavor is bold, but not overpowering or "hot." I also think they would be excellent chopped up and added to a salad.

If you love almonds - especially Blue Diamond Almonds, these are great!  It is like Blue Diamond Almonds on steroids.  They are not incredibly spicy, but they have a little zip and a good amount of flavor.  A better buy than the Habanero BBQ ones for sure.  I would buy them again and they are great with a cold beer.

These are excellent. The flavor is strong and pleasant. I think the package size is perfect for snacking.Besides general use, I recommend these if you go to a desert; these make you want to drink more, which is important as it is easy to get dehydrated and not notice it in desert environment.

I am addicted to sushi, which is an expensive addiction.  I always keep a tin of these at work and at home to satisfy the craving.  My boyfriend, who doesn't like sushi, really enjoys these too, so they aren't just for sushi lovers.  I believe they are roasted, so they are not as healthy as raw almonds, but they still make a great afternoon snack.
These things are great. Perfect size bag for an afternoon snack. If you like salt and vinegar flavor you will like these.

The "Jalapeno Smokehouse" flavor is the best flavor in the Blue Diamond "BOLD" series, hands down. Unlike some of the other flavors, this one really tastes like what it's supposed to taste like -- that is to say, smoky jalapeno peppers. To my jaded taste buds, the pepper spice is fairly mild, but I imagine most people find it packs quite a kick. It's a good thing these huge, perfectly roasted nuts are great for you, because I eat them constantly. Hey, my HDL cholesterol (the "good" cholesterol) has actually risen as I've gotten older. I like to think it's partly because of these luscious babies. Dr Jeddy prescribes a handful every day!

I'm addicted to Blue Diamond almonds. I've tried all the flavors -- and this was the last one I tried. I love salt, I love vinegar, and I love salt-and-vinegar potato chips, so how could I lose with these?Well, I'm just not that into them. The flavor's great and the almonds are fresh, but somehow the texture just fails. The almonds just seem... soggy. They don't have that wonderful crunch that the other Blue Diamond flavors have. And that flattens out the whole experience of eating them. I've eaten about 10 bags so far, and they all have the same lackluster texture.Oh well. Guess even my ol' reliable Blue Diamond can't hit it out of the park every time.

I don't know what they put in these things, but whatever it is it's addictive. The combination of soy sauce salty and wasabi spicy create the perfect storm of "I'm going to eat this entire can RFN."The cans are all perfectly sealed and the almonds are always fresh - what else can you ask for? The cost is also lower than in local stores, but you can buy the larger bags cheaper (per oz) from some Walmarts if you can find them.Almonds are supposed to be appetite suppressants, but for me it's usually because I ate an entire can of them and am not hungry any more.
I gave half of the 6 pack to my friend visiting from Tokyo. We both love them. Although, it would be nice if they came in bigger cans.

Before we switched to eating low carb, we used to LOVE a nice big bag of chips.  I was missing those zesty salty crunchy snacks, until we found these delicious almonds!  I have tried all of the flavors and love them all, but these are my current favorite.  I like the snack size packs as a reminder that I have had enough since I can never stop eating them (just like potato chips, no one can eat just one).  A whole package is only  8 grams of carbs (only 4 grams of net carbs if you are an Atkins dieter).  These almonds have a nice crisp texture (even better if you put them in the refrigerator for a bit) and the seasoning is evenly distributed.  Not to strong, but also not too weak that it gets lost on the almonds. A package of 12 only lasted about a week in our home, back to order more.
These are better than chips -- you can't eat just one!  Seriously, great snack when you're on the run.
If you love salt & vinegar chips like I do, these are for you.  Great salty snack, high in protein, pretty filling, and without the grease of potato chips. Definitely recommend!
The product arrived on time and fresh and this was the only place that I have found this tasty snack.  I would buy them again.

At 260 calories, even this 1.5 oz pack is too much for a snack, but I divide the packs in half again and have a healthy snack that helps satisfy my hunger in the late afternoon.  They're also good as a breakfast on the run. The wasabi adds a wonderful punch-love them!
Too good to last. Next thing I know it's all gone.  Everyone in the family loved it. You can't go wrong with Blue Diamond.

Not generally a big fan of wasabi or of almonds, but somehow find these particular wasabi and soy sauce almonds to be a healthy addiction. Enjoyable all times of the day. Just the right amount of salt and flavor. This is becoming a favorite in my house. I also take it to work to satisfy that afternoon craving.

I wanted more wasabi flavor but there is enough for a good balanced taste. Really, they are pretty good. You can actually find these in walmart for $3 a can so its about the same as buying here.
these are the best flavor - very nice lime/chile taste goes great with the almonds. i agree with ms.cox!

I'll start off by noting that I love almonds, I eat almonds every day, and I particularly love Blue Diamond almonds. The most important qualities of almonds, for me, are freshness, quality, and careful roasting. Blue Diamond almonds get 5 stars on all those parameters.And I've tried all their flavors, especially their "BOLD" line. Alas, their definition of "BOLD" is apparently "a little too spicy for kids." This flavor is okay, as a change of pace, but doesn't exactly set my taste buds a-"blazin'." It doesn't taste like Buffalo wings -- it's too sweet and not vinegary enough. And it's definitely not spicy enough. I realize that real Buffalo wing spice can be brutal, and might not suit a mass-market snacking product. But really, they haven't even tried here. There's not even a hint of Tabasco, for example.As I said, this is a pleasant enough flavor, especially if you need a little change from, say, my favorite, Jalapeno Smokehouse. But it doesn't taste much like anything in particular. They could have called it "BOLD Generic Faux-Spicy Snack to be Eaten Brainlessly While Watching the Game" flavor and it would have been more accurate.

Ordered these because I wanted to try them and none of the stores in my area seem to carry them. Much like the other flavors, the bold flavor makes moderation fairly easy as I could not imagine going overboard on these.  Enjoy!

Having remembered Red Velvet cake from the south as a child, I found this cake mix to be excellent and it has received rave reviews from adults and kids alike.  Rich like chocolate, but lighter - this is a solid favorite of all who try it for the first time. The color is enticing to some, scary to others, but once tasted - with a cream cheese frosting - all are fans.  Easy to make, perfect every time!

For those of you not familiar with the great Urban Legend of the Red Velvet Cake recipe that cost $240 dollars, see Jan Harold Brunvand's series of books on Urban Legends starting with THE VANISHING HITCHIKER available here on Amazon. Most of us know the legend in it's more modern form as the "Mrs. Field's Chocolate Chip cookie recipe" that some poor unsuspecting soul requested and was told would cost "Two-forty" and who assumed that meant Two Dollars and forty cents only to receive a credit card bill of $240. Needless to say the legend is NOT true, never WAS true & never will be true be it about the cookies, Red Velvet Cake or Waldorf Salad( Another part of the legend).Red Velvet Cake started out as a pretty and regional variant of Devil's Food cake and is really just a wonderfully light chocolate cake with red colouring added to it. It is often topped with either a vanilla buttercream frosting or in more modern times with cream cheese frosting. The Duncan Hines mix is probably a better option than any of the current recipes floating around that are often remnents of the old Urband Legend for a variety of reasons. Many of the legendary recipes have bizarre added ingredients intended to make the recipe look weird or authentic and often call for far more food coloring than is needed, imparting a bitter flavor and ghastly colour to the finished cake.Having had the Duncan Hines mix as a child and again more recently, I can attest to its superiority over most of the existing recipes for Red Velvet Cake. The Duncan Hines Cake Mix has a lovely chocolate flavor and just the right amount of red color to make the final product interesting. When made as a layer cake (preferabley with four thin layers as opposed to two thick ones) and topped with Cream cheese icing, the Duncan Hines Red Velvet Cake makes a wonderfully festive Holiday cake sure to provoke conversation. You may find yourself having to give away a number of the boxes of mix you now have to friends eager to make it themselves and share the intriguing legend. The finished cake truly is a show-stopper!Conventional wisdom is that the cake itself began as a Southern tradition and indeed, it can still be found on the dessert menus of some venerable Southern eateries. The best I ever had was in Nashville at an old Inn but it wasn't all that superior to the Duncan Hines mix which is more moist and lighter in texture than most Tradtional ( as opposed to "legendary" ) recipes.You can still find elaborate versions of Red Velvet cake popping up in places such as the Swiss Colony Holiday Catalog but for outragious prices. Do what I do and make your own! Since it is near impossible to find anywhere else, go ahead and order the mix here. Even if you only make it a few times a year, the mix lasts a long time and is a good value when you consider its "Star Quality" as a dessert and a natural conversation piece! I know of one mom whose daughter got an 'A' when using the cake as a demonstration of modern Folklore in her high-school social studies class!If all that info isn't enough inducement to try it...just remember..it's chocolate cake for heaven's sake! And...it's pretty! What more could a person want?

The bottle says "No MSG" but this is actually false advertising.1. In the US, companies are only required to list MSG on the ingredient label as MSG if it is a pure form of free glutamate.2. It is true that this product does not contain pure MSG.3. Many of the ingredients listed contain VERY high levels of MSG (free glutamate), and are included BECAUSE they contain MSG.4. Both Disodium Inosinate and Disodium Guanylate are also included, which are pretty expensive to add, and are only added because they enhance the effects of MSG--they do nothing else. If Kernel Seasons really did not include MSG, there would be no point in adding these other additives (and it would be much cheaper not to add them).Some people choose to eat foods with MSG, and that's ok.  White Cheddar used to be my favorite Kernel Season's flavor before I learned how to read ingredient labels carefully.  If MSG doesn't bother you, go ahead and buy this if you want.  My husband is severely allergic to MSG, though, and when we were first learning to avoid MSG, labels like this caused him to be very sick.  Why not just remove "No MSG" from the package instead of misleading people?  This is really an unethical practice.I felt very disappointed and mislead when I discovered this.  Don't just take my word for it; go learn about the ingredients on the list.
